cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 100 miles E of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: Creeping WNW this evening, then turning north and finally NNE toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi shoreline)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along the southeast Louisiana/Mississippi coast near Biloxi–Gulfport area

weather_observation.watch_coast: None in effect for Louisiana coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Morgan City, LA to Navarre, FL including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through Mississippi, Alabama, and the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (gusts > 74 mph) possible Tuesday night into early Wednesday with sustained tropical-storm conditions beginning tonight.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft of inundation possible near the mouth of the Mississippi River including Plaquemines Parish, with higher water levels (up to 7–11 ft) just east of the port.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated 24 inches possible, producing life-threatening flash flooding and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands; dangerous surf and rip currents.
